== Package handling ==

=== How to install experimental Docker versions on my Ubuntu 16.04 LTS ===

In order to have bleeding edge docker packages in Ubuntu, you can follow these instructions:

1. Add the following line to /etc/apt/sources.list:

     <code>deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/docker/experimental/ubuntu xenial main</code> 

     <code>deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/docker/experimental/ubuntu xenial main</code>

2. Add the PPA key to your keyring

     <code>$ sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 0x6c09f330d9d32a57</code>
 
3. Install the package itself

     <code>$ sudo apt-get update</code>

     <code>$ sudo apt-get install docker.io</code>

4. Remove the old aufs directory
     <code>$ sudo mv /var/lib/docker/aufs /var/lib/docker/aufs.old</code>
     
5. Restart docker daemon
     <code>$ sudo systemctl restart docker</code>

6. Docker is now up and running
     <code>$ docker --version</code>
     <code>Docker version 1.10.2, build c3959b1</code>
